quoted.text:
The headline story is â€œChatGPT losing, Gemini winning.â€ But thatâ€™s missing whatâ€™s actually happening here.

Gemini grew from 5.7% to 21.5% in 12 months. Thatâ€™s nearly 4x growth. Impressive, right?

But how did it grow?

Google has 1.5 billion monthly AI Overview interactions inside Search. Users encounter Gemini without ever choosing it. They just Google something and there it is.

76% of Geminiâ€™s traffic is direct. Theyâ€™ve got 650 million users because they preinstalled it on basically every Android device on Earth.

Thatâ€™s 1-5 billion devices with Gemini baked in.

So when Gemini â€œgains share,â€ users arenâ€™t switching from ChatGPT. Google is converting its existing traffic into AI traffic.

Different game entirely.

Now look at ChatGPTâ€™s numbers differently.

Yes, share dropped from 87% to 65%. But absolute visits? 6.2 billion monthly visits in October. Thatâ€™s 5x Geminiâ€™s 1.2 billion.

ChatGPT has 800+ million weekly active users. Share is dropping because the pie is expanding, not because users are leaving.

Hereâ€™s what I find most intresting though.

Claude sat at 2% all year. Flat.

Looks bad, right? Losing the consumer race?

Except Claude owns 32% of enterprise AI market share. OpenAI has 25%.

88% enterprise retention rate vs industry average of 76%.

The consumer traffic chart is measuring one game while a completely different game is being played underneath.

AI is fragmenting into distinct markets that require different strategies.

Google wins distribution. OpenAI wins consumer mindshare. Anthropic wins enterprise trust.

And xAIâ€™s Grok going from zero to 3.4% in a year with basically just X integration shows thereâ€™s still room for new entrants who own their distribution channel.

Weâ€™re watching segmentation, and each segment has a different leader.
